intro: Callista incrassata, commonly known as the broad-leaved callista, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or open forest habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Callista incrassata plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
